title: Calories in Ribeye Steak
meta_description: Learn calories in ribeye steak per 100 g, plus full nutrition breakdown including protein, fat, carbs, and tips for variations.
assumptions: Boneless ribeye steak, choice grade, trimmed to 1/8 inch fat, grilled, cooked from raw; no added seasonings or marinades.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat trim, grade, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or use a food scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of grilled ribeye steak provides ~285 kcal and ~25 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror standard Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g ribeye steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 285 kcal for grilled ribeye with moderate fat trim.

faqs.q: What's the protein in ribeye steak?
faqs.a: About 25 g protein per 100 g, making it a high-protein choice.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in ribeye steak?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling retains more moisture than frying, but added fats increase calories.

faqs.q: How much fat is in ribeye steak?
faqs.a: Around 20 g total fat per 100 g, with 9 g saturated.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in ribeye steak?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars—it's nearly all protein and fat.
